name: Instagram Broadcast Channel
primary_goal_vibe: Direct distribution, community updates, exclusive drops, and high-signal communication with followers who opted in.
tone_preference: Direct, personal, and concise. Feels like a founder or brand insider speaking, not a marketing broadcast.

copy_guidelines.copy_best_practices: Keep messages short and high-value. Each message should communicate one update, one announcement, or one insight. Avoid long-form storytelling. Prioritize clarity and immediacy.
copy_guidelines.message_structure_hint: Line 1: What this is about. Line 2: Why it matters now. Optional final line: single clear CTA.
copy_guidelines.recommended_message_length: Very short to short. Designed for quick scanning inside DMs.

interaction_guidelines.primary_role: Drive passive consumption first, lightweight interaction second (polls, reactions).
best_practices: Use polls to validate interest before launching content
Use voice notes sparingly for high-trust moments
Link out to feed posts, Reels, or Lives instead of duplicating full content

hashtags_mentions.recommended_hashtags: Not applicable. Hashtags do not play a discovery role in Broadcast Channels.
hashtags_mentions.mention_strategy: Mentions can be used sparingly to highlight collaborators or featured creators.

technical_constraints.delivery_context: Messages appear inside follower inboxes who opted into the channel.
technical_constraints.frequency_recommendation: Low to moderate frequency. 2â€“5 updates per week is a sustainable range.
technical_constraints.content_persistence: Messages remain inside the channel history and can be revisited.
technical_constraints.media_support: Supports text, images, short videos, voice notes, and polls.

required_elements: High relevance to the follower base
disallowed_practices: Posting full-length captions from feed posts without adaptation
Using the channel as a high-frequency promo dump
Multiple competing CTAs in a single update
